screen_desc: The screenshot displays the "Apps & notifications" settings page on a smartphone. It shows recently opened apps such as Gmail, Photos, and Google, each with their respective time stamps. The page also includes options for notifications, default apps, permission manager, emergency alerts, and special app access, providing users with various settings to manage their device's functionality.
action_think: The user wants to turn off picture-in-picture notifications. The history actions show that the user has navigated to the 'Apps & notifications' settings page and is currently in the 'Advanced' section. The next action should be to look for the 'Picture-in-picture' option and toggle it off.
action_plan: scroll to the 'Picture-in-picture' option in the 'Advanced' section
click on the toggle switch next to 'Picture-in-picture' to turn it off
action_desc: scroll to the 'Picture-in-picture' option in the 'Advanced' section
action_result: The selected item 'Picture-in-picture' has been removed from the list, which means that this specific permission is no longer active for any apps. This aligns with the user's request to turn off picture-in-picture.
